no crash

I'm getting numerous Evolution crashes without user interaction.  I haven't found any pattern but more often then not it seems to occur at some point after I've accessed the calender component (with a Groupwise backend).  Bug buddy setup a bug at  but since this is OpenSUSE specific I wanted to report it here as well.  I will attach a few sample crashes.

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.22 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/25.0.1364.160 Safari/537.22

I get frequent crashes (2-3 times an hour) of the plasma desktop shell when using apps like Akregator and Thunderbird. There seems to be a bug in the QDeclarativeRepeater function when removing items from the list of notifications. 

The bug was reported upstream at .
I am hoping for a quick fix once the problem is solved, please don't wait for 4.10.1...

So I tried to create an empty virgin user and it worked right from the start. 
The problem should have then been a configuration problem. So I renamed to "oldxxx" .libreoffice .fonts and I did install bit bleach to get rid of all old temp, tmp and whatever not more valid config files. As a result I was now able to open "libreoffice office" with the selection. All but writer would crash immediately without notice even in terminal, but with libreoffice writer that gave in terminal:
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0xaf05cee3, pid=5819, tid=2982295680
#
# JRE version: 7.0_17-b02
# Java VM: OpenJDK Client VM (23.7-b01 mixed mode linux-x86 )
# Problematic frame:
# C  [libpolyester.so+0x1bee3]  PolyesterStyle::drawComplexControl(QStyle::ComplexControl, QStyleOptionComplex const*, QPainter*, QWidget const*) const+0x16f3
#
# Failed to write core dump. Core dumps have been disabled. To enable core dumping, try "ulimit -c unlimited" before starting Java again
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as:
# /home/user/hs_err_pid5819.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please include
# instructions on how to reproduce the bug and visit:
#   

Now, I am not a light bulb for what is reasoning but that seemed to me a conflict between java and a precedent polyester installation. 
I did check in Jast and found polyester (two packages, base and another one installed, I think lang but I am not sure, can investigate if useful). I did eliminate the two packages and restarted the KDE session. And voil¨¤! it works, libreoffice now works flawlessly. As the "trial and error" took me quite some time, I report it as a "normal" bug, I recall having read that somebody else had some problem with polyester (ahhh that plastic thing!) so it may be useful.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install opensuse 12.2 with polyester (with respect to the settings of polyester consider the terminal output delivered. Nvidia driver - always most recent G02 were used). 
2. Install 12.3 from the scratch. Start openoffice. It will crash without notice.
3. start openoffice from the terminal, you will get the output as of above.
4. uninstall polyester style = libreoffice runs well. 
Actual Results:  
after upgrade, libreoffice crashes inconditonally without notice, running from terminal eventually hints to polyester and a java crash. 

Expected Results:  
Libreoffice should work as expected regardless of the presence of polyester. 

If you contact me within short notice (sorry for eastern, let us say withing tuesday night) I will be able to give you more detailed info. 
After this I will travel so I will not have physically my hands on the machine. Sorry. (Another "running sneaker admin" I guess).

7. Right-click on 'New Folder' again and choose 'Paste Into Folder'.

Crash occurs in GetResources() because the code is attempting to 
adjust elements in the input/output array 'typed_args' while still 
referring to the original offsets with the marker arrays 'typed' and 'found'.

The patch corrects the error by not 'compressing the list' array 'typed_args'
until all the args have been processed.

I am using currently Leap with WLAN (for the first time since installation). 
I am encountering a nasty, constantly presenting, persistent bug that presents as follows: 
when the machine stands for while without being used, it appears that the wlan module looses connectivity. The machine is not in suspend mode (appears more a powersave state) It is then not able to relog into wlan no matter what. logout kde has no effect. su - , sysctl rcnetwork restart does not restore connection as well has no effect. You get a precise pattern in the journal beginning with:
"Could not load the [0] uCode section"
this repeats all the time until reboot. I put an example as txt in attachment. 

I is nasty because you have to restart the machine completely to get wlan working again. 

Lenovo X201

My setup for analysing kernel crashdumps is a directory called "unpacked" where I have

unpacked/SLES10
unpacked/SLES11

and beneath I have one directory for each kernel version. e.g.

unpacked/SLES10/0.33/xen/

in these directories I have the -debuginfo files for the corresponding version unpacked, so I can quickly open a core with

cd <appropriate directory>
crash boot/System.map.<version> boot/vmlinux-<version>.gz /path/to/vmcore

this has worked for some time and makes my work a lot easier. In 12.1 crash changed, and no longer looks at $PWD. strace shows

15102 open("/tmp/vmlinux-2.6.32.45-0.3.2.3545.0.PTF-xen.debug", O_RDONLY) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)
15102 open("/tmp/.debug/vmlinux-2.6.32.45-0.3.2.3545.0.PTF-xen.debug", O_RDONLY) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)
15102 open("/usr/lib/debug//tmp/vmlinux-2.6.32.45-0.3.2.3545.0.PTF-xen.debug", O_RDONLY) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)
15102 open("/usr/lib/debug/tmp/vmlinux-2.6.32.45-0.3.2.3545.0.PTF-xen.debug", O_RDONLY) = -1 ENOENT (No such file or directory)

and it also tries
15102 access("/usr/lib/debug/.build-id/f7/b4a3181586bbbabd4ab2283d2bf23d3f84e8c6.debug", F_OK) = -1 ENOENT

This is a complete departure from how crash worked in previous versions, and if $PWD is not used as before, it makes reading kernel dumps much harder.

Eclipse frequently crashes when using Sun Java 1.6.0_05
Crash occurs occasionally, most often triggered by modifying the java build path (e.g. adding source folders).

Java virtual machines causes a SIGSEGV in native code.
Issue is known: 
<>

See although message by Andrey Tabachnik in
<>
where 2 workarounds are suggested.

As Java 1.6 was made a requirement in
<>
most people using Eclipse in openSUSE will run into this problem.

Possible workarounds until Sun fixes the bug in the jvm:
add -XX:CompileCommand=exclude,org/eclipse/core/internal/dtree/DataTreeNode,forwardDeltaWith
or 
-client 
to VM_ARGS in /etc/eclipse.ini
or
-remove the unnecessary requirement for java >=1.6 from eclipse packages (recompile for java 1.5) and set eclipse to use a working java 1.5 version.

I am testing openSUSE 13.1 Milestone 2 x86_64 on VirtualBox 4.2.16 r86992 in

Host information:  .


I changed a setup of VM of "Setting"->"Display"->"Enable 3D acceleration" into "ON"

I changed session into Xfce .
I selected Applications Menu->"Setting"->"Setting Manager" .
I selected "Personal"->"Screensaver" .
I changed "Mode" into "Random Screen Saver" .
I selected all screen savers .
I turned OFF "Lock Screen After" .
I changed "Blank After" into 1 minnutes and "Cycle After" into 1 minutes .
I closed "Screensaver Preferences" .

And I waited without doing anything for 2 days . 

The xscreensaver crashed twice during the 2 days with Segmentation fault in kill() at ../sysdeps/unix/syscall-template.S:81 and X screen hanged-up .

I attach the GDB backtrace files .

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
0. Change a setup of VM of "Setting"->"Display"->"Enable 3D acceleration" into "ON"
1. Change session into Xfce .
2. Select "Applications Menu"->"Setting"->"Setting Manager" .
3. Select "Personal"->"Screensaver" .
4. Change "Mode" into "Random Screen Saver" .
5. Select all screen savers .
6. Turn OFF "Lock Screen After" .
7. Change "Blank After" into 1 minnutes and "Cycle After" into 1 minutes .
8. Close "Screensaver Preferences" .
9. Wait a number of days without doing anything .
Actual Results:  
The xscreensaver crashed twice during the 2 days with Segmentation fault in kill() at ../sysdeps/unix/syscall-template.S:81 and X screen hanged-up .


Expected Results:  
The xscreensave shoud not crash and X screen should not hang-up .

Not my best bug report, I didn't get useful stack traces.

But kget in stock openSUSE 11.2 (KDE 4.3.1) seems rather buggy and crashy.  This was exposed after Net Install of 11.2, whilst downloading the release DVD ISO's via metalink over a few days.

Checking what was going on with torrent, by opening up the details of the download group would sometimes provoke a crash.  Intended to find simple steps to reproduce, but for seeding purposes have needed to move to ktorrent & transmission.  For moment I'm not using kget much so this is best report I'm likely to do.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Download openSUSE DVD ISO via metalink, konqi punts to kget
2.Investigate Torrent file details & generally "use" kget
3.Observe crashes generally using right click for context menu
Actual Results:  
Ocasional stack traces, but with stock "stable" KDE 4.1.3 without debug symbols I don't think they're very useful.

Expected Results:  
Boring solidity.

My impression is that KDE-4.3.3 from OBS is much more solid, than the stock "stable" 4.3.1 version.  Reviews at Distrowatch & LWN have also mentioned KDE crashes, may be a lot of fixes need to be backported, or our "stable" get bumped to a themed 4.3.3 via update.  It really is time for KDE4 to deliver a solid desktop like KDE 1, 2 & 3 did.

After a while of working or switching the languages in my case from German to Chinese and back, one is prevented to type any characters or letters within Opera or OpenOffice.

The mouse is still usable, so you can klick on save before the next step.
If you have an OpenOffice document opened and you click on exit [SKIM] OpenOffice crashes. SKIM restores itself and you can type again.
Opera does not crash if you exit SKIM,
This behaviour occured first time in OpenSUSE 10.3

Instead of exiting you can also ende Opera and OpenOffice and restart them.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open OpenOffice
2. Switch several times between Chinese and English/German [CTRL-SPACE] and wait
3. Exit SKIM
Actual Results:  
OpenOffice crashed

Expected Results:  
Not crashing, not even been prevented from typing.

KDE3.5 and KDE4.x.x x=means 1,2 and 3 all in use on different computers
Happens if the environment is set as German. Did not check if this occures with chinese environment.

I was trying to test out kde4 and found that I can get plasma, and then the rest of kde4 to crash. Nasty crashes, too.

How to replicate:

Become some other user (root is what I used, I wanted to change root's KDE4 settings without having to log out):

$ ssh -l $SOMEUSER -X localhost 

Run Xnest

# Xnest :1

Export the display variable

# export DISPLAY=:1

run an xterm

# xterm

In the Xnest window, in the newly popped-up xterm, type 'startkde'.

kde4 will start, plasma will crash, and then shortly thereafter the whole thing (including Xnest) comes down quite ungracefully.

remote machine:

I'm using an HP Notebook with 8GB of RAM, a quad core Intel Pentium N3710 CPU, and an integrated Intel HD Graphics 405 Braswell graphics card, with openSUSE Tumbleweed (kernel 5.5.6 at the time of writing) with KDE Plasma 5.18 (but was using KDE Plasma 5.17 when I first encountered the bug). Until about a month ago, I was using my laptop with an old 15 inch Acer monitor as the primary display (connected with VGA). This month, I bought a new 24 inch BenQ monitor, and plugged it into my laptop with an HDMI cable provided with the monitor.

Right off the bat, I started facing issues. For starters, my mouse pointer would get stuck on the left side of the screen (only visually. I could still highlight and click stuff in that region. The pointer would just visually stay still there until I moved it away from the edge). I found the bug reported here: . However, it seems like there was no proper fix for it.

Secondly, I started getting random screen freezing when doing stuff like scrolling webpages or typing messages in Telegram Desktop (it'd freeze when an emoji suggestion was about to popup for the word I'd typed), etc. The screen would freeze for about 10 to 15 seconds before responding again. While this was somewhat manageable initially, it started becoming too common; And in some cases, it'd also cause my entire session to crash (it'd take me back to sddm's login screen).

Things I've tried to resolve the issue:

- Using a VGA cable: This solved the pointer getting stuck on the left edge issue. But the screen freezing and crash still persisted.
- Switching the compositor's rendering back-end and scaling method: This somewhat reduced the occurrence of the freezing and crashes, but didn't entirely make it go away.
- Switching to the xf86-video-intel package / Changing the driver "AccelMethod" to "sna": This again fixed the pointer getting stuck on the left edge issue, but introduced terrible screen tearing and flicker (and didn't fix the screen freezing and crashes either).
- Switching to the xf86-video-intel package and configuring "DRI" and "TearFree": After setting "DRI" to "2", "TearFree" to "true", rendering back-end to Xrender and scaling method to "Smooth", my system became somewhat useable. However, the screen freezing became even worse (it'd freeze and never unfreeze. It wouldn't take me back to sddm either. I couldn't even access a TTY. A hard reboot was the only way out).
- Using Wayland: Results were the same, if not worse. Screen freezing would occur even more often (even for simple things such as adjusting the volume from the panel).

I'm sure this is an issue with my graphics card and driver and not my monitor, because I tried using my monitor with my laptop after installing Windows 10, and it worked perfectly. The issue only happens on Linux (regardless of the distro or DE) and it's the most noticeable on openSUSE (from what I'd tried. For example, I'd tried Manjaro, and the freezing and crashing was a little less frequent).

This is the first bug report I've filed. So please let me know what other information is required.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Connect a 24 inch monitor with HDMI/VGA to a laptop with the Intel HD Graphics 405 Braswell graphics card.
2. Use any Linux distro with the modesetting/intel driver.
Actual Results:  
Terrible screen freezing and crashes.

Expected Results:  
No screen freezing or crashes.

When hovering over a reference to a footnote, a preview appears. However, when the footnote is long (> 4 lines), the preview is distorted (something I can live with), and when it is very long (7 lines or more) OpenOffice crahes, taking with it the whole X server. This happens also with a clean user directory, so no corrupted personal settings.
I just found a Ubuntu bug report with the same thing with Gnome and Compiz (I use KDE SC and KWin), see . Compiz actually reports "text length exceeded".

It's very annoying, because in my scientific writings I have a lot of long footnotes and every now and then OOo crashes. It took me weeks to find out the reason.

OpenSuse 11.3, KDE SC 4.5.0, Kernel 2.6.34-12, ATI Radeon XPRESS 200M with radeon driver

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Take a document with long footnotes (example attached)
2. Hover over the references in the text
Actual Results:  
with more than 6 lines in the footnote, X crashes

I have a Dell laptop with an Intel iGPU and a Radeon dGPU (a Firepro W5130M, recognized as a Radeon HD 8830M by lspci).
Whenever I attempt to use the radeon card it crashes. To attempt to diagnose the problem, I use glxgears to test. It works sometimes, but if I close and open glxgears a few times, it will crash and the card will cease to work until a reboot.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run DRI_PRIME=1 glxgears

Was using LibreOffice 5.2.5.1 and multiple times while using writer, the screen and keyboard would freeze up, and then plasma workspace would reset. This happened only while using LibreOffice Writer, and only on my Dell XPS 13.

Since upgrading to LibreOffice 5.3.3.2, I have not experienced the fault again. It was recommended that I file this bug report in case the crash dump and other information indicates something that needs to be addressed in a future kernel or other hardware driver. I was using kernel 4.11.5 when the fault happened. I have since upgraded to kernel 4.12.1.

semi embargoed via libvirt security list, 

2 week embargo starting Sep 3, but no specific date set yet
so perhaps CRD 2013-09-17

CVE-2013-4297

                                                                                                                     
From: "Daniel P. Berrange" <>

If there were no free NBD devices found, then it was possible
to jump to a cleanup block which calls VIR_FREE on an uninitialized
string pointer.

This would cause the libvirt_lxc process to crash when starting an
LXC guest if NBD devices were exhausted.

If fine grained ACLs are active and the user is only given permission
to start/stop guests, then this flaw can be classed as a security issue
since the libvirt_lxc process will not have finished setting up the
container security confinement at this point and the user triggering it
is less privileged than root.

This was introduced in release v1.0.6 onwards by

  commit 8aabd597b379db5ae1655e36dff4f10d5622830a
  Author: Daniel P. Berrange <>
  Date:   Mon Apr 22 15:06:16 2013 +0100

    Add a helper API for setting up a NBD device with qemu-nbd

Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <>

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; zh-CN; rv:1.9.0.7) Gecko/2009021910 Firefox/3.0.7 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)

Root cause:
in trunk\uia2atk\UIAutomationWinforms\UIAutomationWinforms\Mono.UIAutomation.Winforms\ListProvider.cs, Ln 114.

if (items.TryGetValue (objectItem, out item) == false) {

the input objectItem is null, and accroding to the specification, when we query a null key on a dictionary (the type of "items" is "Dictionary<object, ListItemProvider>"), there will be an ArgumentNullException.

P.S. I didn't dig in enough to find out why the incoming objectItem is null, since Neville and I failed to analyze it with mdb this afternoon. And the sample test, ripped from this Web page: , is meant to demostrate another defect in SWF, where DataGridViewComboBoxCell failed to handle the "DisplayMember" property.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch the enclosed sample, you may use latest trunk monodevelop to build the source, or launch the binary .exe directly


Actual Results:  
Program Crashes.
ListProvider throw an ArgumentNullException.

Expected Results:  
A form pop up, in which there is a DataGridView control.
(And that's the result when running the same binary with Microsoft's .Net runtime, and also the result when running the binary with the released mono 2.2 runtime, though there is some other minor defects when running with mono 2.2 runtime).

Every few days gdm crashes, and it turns out this is caused by dbus crashing. It can be reproduced on both:
(1) a 32-bit workstation running a local X server
(2) a 64-bit server running remote X logins and no local X server

No core file is generated.

You can demonstrate the problem as follows:
 # ps -fp `cat /var/run/gdm.pid`
 # rcdbus stop
 # ps -fp `cat /var/run/gdm.pid`

Note that only the parent gdm process dies, so existing xdm sessions still continue, but no further logins are accepted.

Also note that 'rcxdm status' reports that gdm is still running and 'rcxdm start' does nothing. You have to restart gdm by hand, e.g.
  gdm --nodaemon --no-console

Due to a  bug tgif used to crash badly when trying to enter characters of any kind into a graph starting with leap 42.3.
This issue is related to the entry

Tgif.SingleByteInputMethod:    xim

in /usr/share/X11/app-defaults.
This has been fixed in the Opensuse Build Service. I kindly ask to upgrade the packages in the field as everyone using this program is directly affected by this bug.

The about:crashcontent and about:crashparent pages can be triggered by web
content. These pages are used to crash the loaded page or the browser for test
purposes. This issue allows for a non-persistent denial of service (DOS) attack
by a malicious site which links to these pages. This vulnerability affects
Firefox < 64.

CVE-2017-10919

                    Xen Security Advisory XSA-223
                              version 2

              ARM guest disabling interrupt may crash Xen

UPDATES IN VERSION 2
====================

Public release.

ISSUE DESCRIPTION
=================

Virtual interrupt injection could be triggered by a guest when sending
an SGI (e.g IPI) to any vCPU or by configuring timers. When the virtual
interrupt is masked, a missing check in the injection path may result in
reading invalid hardware register or crashing the host.

IMPACT
======

A guest may cause a hypervisor crash, resulting in a Denial of Service
(DoS).

VULNERABLE SYSTEMS
==================

All Xen versions which support ARM are affected.

x86 systems are not affected.

MITIGATION
==========

On systems where the guest kernel is controlled by the host rather than
guest administrator, running only kernels which do not disable SGI and
PPI (i.e IRQ < 32) will prevent untrusted guest users from exploiting
this issue. However untrusted guest administrators can still trigger it
unless further steps are taken to prevent them from loading code into
the kernel (e.g by disabling loadable modules etc) or from using other
mechanisms which allow them to run code at kernel privilege.

CREDITS
=======

This issue was discovered by Julien Grall of ARM.

CVE-2018-14619

Gday,

Syzkaller/syzbot found a use-after-free bug in the cryptographic
subsystem of the Linux kernel [1], that can be used to panic the
system and possibly escalate privileges.

The bug was introduced in commit 72548b093ee3, and has been addressed
in b32a7dc8aef1882fbf983eb354837488cc9d54dc, a reproducer is available
on the tail end of  syzbots email to kernel list (
 ).  Most RHEL kernels are not
affected as they do not have the feature, but it does affect the
kernel-alt package (the 4.11 based kernel for 64-bit ARM , IBM POWER9
(little endian ) and IBM z Systems ).

Upstream fix:

Thanks.

firefox shouldn't crash on removable media disconnection

This behaviour appeared after reinstallation of opensuse 10.1 first (clear reinstall without upgrade). I used the same mozilla profile from ~/.mozilla (to keep my bookmarks, certs, extensions, addons). But, when I remove it and try to reproduce the behaviour without ~/.mozilla, firefox crashes anyway.

I am experiencing periodical system freezes which to my knowledge are caused by a GPU lockup. Those freezes are always triggered by 3D rendering, and are seemingly produced by a multitude of game engines. The crash is highly probabilistic, with various programs having a chance of triggering it anywhere between one minute and one hour. The image instantly freezes in place while audio stops working and every form of input dies (including the NumLock / CapsLock keyboard leds), the machine is entirely bricked until powered off and back on.

The problem is oddly similar to an issue I experienced an year ago, which had the exact same behavior and was also caused by 3D. That issue was fixed as every system component has received major updates since, however it seems to have come back sometime during the last few months. I will link its report here as it may still contain useful information:



My OS is Linux openSUSE Tumbleweed x64: Kernel 4.15.7, Xorg X11 Server 1.19.6, Mesa 18.0.0, xf86-video-ati 17.10.0, xf86-video-amdgpu 18.0.0. My motherboard is a Gigabyte GA-X58A-UD7 (rev 1.0). My video card is a Radeon R7 370 (Gigabyte) (rev 1.0), Pitcairn Islands GPU, GCN 1.0, RadeonSI.

When opening any new window (application, dialog, menu, etc) the window will often never appear and remains in an invisible state. Its process does however exist and is fully responsive. KWin seems to think it's there too, however Plasma doesn't show it in the task manager and alt-tab switching selects something non-existent... for example the drawing and selection order of windows completely breaks when an unrendered dialog is present. If attempting to switch desktops during this time, the session will crash and you're taken back to the login screen: Only way to "disarm" such crashes is to kill the process behind such a window (eg: from KSysGuard)... attempting to open the application again will usually work, though it may take several tries before the window will spawn properly. This issue renders the Plasma Wayland session next to unusable and requires constant user attention to work around hidden windows.

I tried several things which don't seem to prevent the problem: First was a suggestion to boot with the amdgpu.dc=0 parameter which did not affect the issue. I attempted different combinations under System Settings - Hardware - Display and Monitor - Compositor, the scale method / render backend (OpenGL 2.0 or 3.1) / vsync didn't affect it either. I also played with some parameters under the Compositing section of ~/.config/kwinrc but couldn't find proper documentation on what each one does and what in there might help.

Linux openSUSE Tumbleweed x64. Plasma 5.18.4. Mesa 20.0.4. Wayland 1.18 / 1.20. KWayland 5.68. AMD Radeon (TM) R9 390 Series (HAWAII, DRM 3.36.0, 5.6.2-1-default, LLVM 10.0.0). KWin theme is Aurorae, themes in use include:

All versions of Node.js 9.x and 10.x are vulnerable and the severity is HIGH. An
attacker can cause a denial of service (DoS) by causing a node process which
provides an http server supporting TLS server to crash. This can be accomplished
by sending duplicate/unexpected messages during the handshake. This
vulnerability has been addressed by updating the TLS implementation.

CVE-2013-2930

affects Linux kernel 3.4 onwards

commit 12ae030d54ef250706da5642fc7697cc60ad0df7
Author: Steven Rostedt <>
Date:   Tue Nov 5 12:51:11 2013 -0500

    perf/ftrace: Fix paranoid level for enabling function tracer
    
    The current default perf paranoid level is "1" which has
    "perf_paranoid_kernel()" return false, and giving any operations
    that use it, access to normal users. Unfortunately, this includes
    function tracing and normal users should not be allowed to enable
    function tracing by default.
    
    The proper level is defined at "-1" (full perf access), which
    "perf_paranoid_tracepoint_raw()" will only give access to. Use that
    check instead for enabling function tracing.
    
    Reported-by: Dave Jones <>
    Reported-by: Vince Weaver <>
    Tested-by: Vince Weaver <>
    Cc: Peter Zijlstra <>

    CVE: CVE-2013-2930
    Fixes: ced39002f5ea ("ftrace, perf: Add support to use function
    tracepoint in perf") Signed-off-by: Steven Rostedt

With the 00clear sleep.d hook, attempt to suspend to disk will crash the system if called in X - the screen darkens with only very dim "spilled tea"-like characters blinking in the background and keyboard not responding (not even sysrq appears to work).

When I disable this particular hook, things work fine, which is really strange, because if I run the openvt command manually from terminal (even if I later do suspend to disk), it doesn't crash; also, the crash itself certainly happens after network is down, I can see that flickering through tail -f.

Also, it doesn't crash with this hook if suspend to disk is performed from textmode.

kicker seems to crash on logout when inputmethods are enabled. there is a patch in qt3 for 10.1 which seems to fix the issue. 

see for example

Trying to use Swap over NFS on openSUSE-11.4 is resulting in a crash.

Reproducer:

* Restrict physical memory to (say 256M) while booting to ensure swap
  gets exercised on the client.
* swapoff -a
* On the NFS server, create a swap file on the NFS export
	dd if=/dev/zero of=swapfile.swp count=1048576 bs=1024
 	mkswap swapfile.swp
* Enable file for swapping on the client
	swapon /mnt/nfs/swapfile.swp

I'm occasionally able to reproduce it (openQA triggers it fairly reliably) and was able to gdb into the crashing process once.
It's visible that libsolv's stringpool is intact, but the to be inserted string pointer points into deallocated (unmapped) space.

It can also be seen that the crashed process has a open file handle to a deleted solv cache:

35 -> /var/cache/zypp/solv/openSUSE-1-0/solv (deleted)
37 -> /mnt/var/cache/zypp/solv/@System/solv

That implies that it deleted an in-use pool, which seems dangerous and seems related to .

I use virsh to start Windows guest and use SPICE client to access the desktop. If I start the Windows VM domain the first time after a reboot and connect to it via SPICE, it crashes within a minute or two without doing anything. A restart of the domain in virsh works without any problems. Logs and version info given below. This problem started to appear since one of the builds of kvm in the last few months

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Reboot host
2. Start Windows XP (or 7) VM domain from virsh
3. Connect from remote SPICE client
4. Wait for the crash/shutdown of guest VM
Actual Results:  
The guest VM is shutdown. There are no errors in the guest VM logs. It is like a forced power off as far as the guest is concerned.

Expected Results:  
KVM should not crash the guest VM

KVM compiled from source at



using just --with spice parameter to rpmbuild

Current software versions:
Kernel 2.6.37.6-0.5-desktop
KVM kvm-0.14.1.0-108.1.x86_64
libvirt libvirt-0.9.3-138.2.x86_64
spice-client spice-client-0.8.1-1.1.x86_64
soice server libspice-server1-0.8.1-1.1.x86_64

Note the very large memory allocation to the qxl graphics driver in the qemu-kvm command line in the attachment. Don't know if this is relevant.

Please do keep in mind that this always happens ONLY on the first start of a VM, not subsequent starts so the bug can only be in things that persist over multiple invocations which rules out many of the components.

The only log entry tied to this event is the virtio trying to map MMIO memory which doesn't appear on subsequent starts where it doesn't crash. This is the most obvious clue. Perhaps there is a timeout error when this is attempted the first time but is done and available for subsequent starts which may indicate a problem with upstream qemu in the kernel. I am just guessing here. Don't have any experience with the code or architecture of these components.

---- Additional Comments From  2004-02-24 19:25:09 MST ----

Ok I isolated further and found that the following line was crashing 
the compiler:

//		private double _dTimerInterval = 1000 * Int32.Parse
(Utility.GetAppSetting("Time Scaler"));

This worked under previous versions of Mono. I tried changing the 
line to reference the method GetAppSetting and copied it locally to 
the class:

		public static string GetAppSetting(string sKey)
		{
			string sRet = "";

			lock(typeof(DCWatcher))
			{
				if( (sKey == null) || (sKey.Equals
("")) )
				{
					throw new Exception
("Argument validation exception");
				}

				try
				{
					AppSettingsReader appr = new 
System.Configuration.AppSettingsReader();
					sRet = (string)appr.GetValue
(sKey, typeof(string));
				}
				catch(Exception getsetex)
				{
					sRet = getsetex.Message;
				}
			}

			return sRet;
		}

This did not work so I tried the following:

//		private double _dTimerInterval = 1000 * Int32.Parse
(Utility.GetAppSetting("Time Scaler"));
		private int i = Int32.Parse(GetAppSetting("test"));
		private double _dTimerInterval = 1000;// * i;

and in the constructor:

			_dTimerInterval *= i;

and now it compiles successfully. It would be great if I don't have 
to propogate these changes to the rest of the project.

Dilton




---- Additional Comments From  2004-02-24 19:31:51 MST ----

Correction to my last...simply moving GetAppSettings from

Microsoft (R) .NET Framework PE Verifier  Version 1.1.4322.573

Utils.dll that you build.  If it has the above problem, then something
is wrong with your mono install -- mcs CVS as of about a week ago does
not have the problem; I don't have 0.31 installed anywhere to test.

message when it tries to load a corrupt assembly.. specifically, in
this case, one with MONO_TABLE_ASSEMBLY table in the image set to 0's.

Build Identifier: GnuCash 2.6.3 This copy was built from rev 4e4a032+ on 2014-07-20.

There's a patch released upstream called "gnucash-libdbi-0.9.patch", this patch adds a new function called "_dbi_make_datetime", which doesn't exist in dbi 0.9, it's introduced to dbi in git commit [ac482c], which is not in OpenSUSE yet.

This means, that GnuCash crashes if I try to open a postgresql database, with this error:
gnucash: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib64/gnucash/libgncmod-backend-dbi.so: undefined symbol: _dbi_make_datetime

there are 2 ways to resolve this.. Either remove the above mentioned patch from the GnuCash build, or update dbi to latest git version.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. try to open a postgresql database
Actual Results:  
GnuCash crashes

Expected Results:  
Should open it

I ran into a similar problem w/ the nrpms.net monodevelop &
mono-complete-1.1.9 packages.  System.Drawing is in the
mono-winforms(1.1.9) package which isn't pulled in by mono-complete.

'yum install mono-winforms' and see if that fixes the problem.

What happens till now:

Since this update, my nis+nfs clients hangs. After following the discussion
here I repaired them, and also solved the *.rpm{new/save}* on my server
according my best knowladge. But the server crashes completly, so nothing
works anymore. The only possible solution was to install him new with
20200205 tumbleweed install package. Due to the fact, that the installation
hangs, I disconnected all not root HDDs and installed him new and connect
afterwords all HDDs and mount them again (mainly /home).

Afterwords I installed dns_server, dhcpd, nis_server and nfs_server. I
cofigured all via yast2 <servicename>. All works fine, only problem is the
nis_server. After configuration, I closed yast window an during generation of
the configfiles, there was an error, but if I open the log via button in the
message, it was empty. Afterwords yast2 nis_server crashes during reading of

Fix for  resulted in icecream online update to version 1.0.0, which, while fixing major bugs, introduced a problem to handling of /var/run/icecc subdirectory, leading to icecream daemon crashing the first time after every boot. This means that icecream daemon needs to be started manually, or it will not be actually active even if enabled.

Whenever I switch my desktop to Folder View and attempt to rename an item there then select the text I'm editing by selecting and right-clicking it, my entire desktop becomes gray / black and gets stuck that way although I can still switch between windows.

firefox strace

In the newest release of OpenSUSE Leap 42.3 nearly all important X clients (firefox, thunderbird, gimp, inkscape...) crash with SIGSEGV. XFCE (my main desktop environment) doesn't work at all, KDE/Plasma 5 crashes in KDEinit but works thereafter). IceWM and some other small WMs work but applications don't start there either.

I tried first with my own network installation which contains some specialities (LDAP auth, common /usr/local via NFS...) but even the vanilla installation from the DVD (Build 0330) shows this behaviour. I tried nouveau and nVidia drivers for my Geforce GT 630 and both showed identical behaviour.

This renders 42.3 totally useless!!!

I searched for similar bug reports and can't believe I'm the only one with such problems. It's an ordinary Fujitsu ESPRIMO P920 with a SSD - nothing special.

I attached strace logs of firefox and inkscape.

Firefox additionally wrote 

ExceptionHandler::GenerateDump cloned child ExceptionHandler::WaitForContinueSignal waiting for continue signal...

Unknown operating system unknown. Setting to default OS "Other".

I guess it's hard to reproduce, but the openSUSE 10.3 Eclipse crashed a lot with out of memory exceptions because the heap was full. It occurred in different situations for already rather simple operations (e.g. updating the workspace).

Everything (i.e. the same projects with the same complexity) worked fine with Eclipse 3.2.1 under openSUSE 10.2 with the default settings.

Increasing the default heap size in eclipse.ini to 1GB didn't solve the problem. The crashes kept occurring.

Removing all openSUSE Eclipse RPMS and manually updating to Eclipse 3.3.1 seems to have solved the problem. Now a heap of 256 MB is sufficient again.

rpmlint crash traceback

When rpmlint is used to check an RPM that includes files with special characters in their names it crashes, throwing a UnicodeDecodeError. I've attached the attached traceback.

This occurs when I run rpmlint locally and when the openSUSE Build Service runs it after compiling the package (which results in the package not being published).
I've seen this bug in openSUSE 13.2 and 13.1, but it probably affects all versions, and probably all other RPM distros as well.

I encountered this problem when I was creating my first RPM package.
This is the package: 
Currently the .spec file has a workaround for that issue (the offending file is renamed in the %install section). That workaround must be removed to reproduce this issue (it should be easy to find).

Issue Description:
SLES15 SP2 inbox - Crash after login into iSCSI targets with bnx2i (kernel BUG at ../block/bio.c:1844!)

Hardware/Software:
SUT: SUT6144, Dell PowerEdge R720xd
AUT: 57840 2x10G
BC: MBI 7.15.36
OS: SLES15 SP2 Snap4
Targets: Compellent, Equallogic

Notes:
1) Not seen over software TCP path
2) Seen with 2 different targets attempted

Procedures:
1) Boot system with iomem=relaxed in grub line (workaround in order for iSCSI to work)
2) Perform discovery to target (i.e. iscsiadm -m discovery -t st -p 192.168.4.20 -I port0)
3) Log into target (i.e. #iscsiadm -m node -L all)
4) Shows login successful but then hard crashes immediately

Reproducibility:
100%

Loading of nf_conntrack_ipv4 with a Xen-Dom0 immediately stops the system without giving any message - no stacktrace, no oops.

Workaround:
Because it doesn't work anyway within the xen-environment remove nf_conntrack_ipv4.ko from Xen-Kernel package.

How to reproduce:
 Boot into a Xen-Dom0
 # modprobe nf_conntrack_ipv4

Reproduced on two different systems. The problem occurred when calling a fwbuilder generated firewall-script that automatically loads any conntrack module that can be found in /lib/kernel.../ipv4

Created 
scheduled fix

The problem is that a 64-bit guest can get one of its vcpus into
non-kernel mode without first providing a valid non-kernel pagetable.
The iret-into-userspace path has the right checks, but just setting the
context on a fresh vcpu doesn't. :(  The observed failure mode is
usually a hard lockup of the host.

Patch is attached.

All shipping 64-bit Xen versions are affected.

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.0.8) Gecko/2009032600 SUSE/3.0.8-1.3 Firefox/3.0.8

First boot after installing openSUSE 11.2 Milestone 1 leaves an almost unresponsive system during X setup.  The power button successfully shuts down, but no keyboard input does anything.  After rebooting, I chose runlevel 3 in GrUB and added the following line to the Device section of xorg.conf:

Option "AccelMethod" "UXA"

I also remarked out a line that looked specific to EXA.  Saving the file and switching to runlevel 5 resulted in a completely functional desktop.  (Additionally, I would like to point out that using 'glxgears' or 'maniadrive' as a crude benchmark shows about a 25% boost in performance above Fedora 10, which in turn is about 9% faster than openSUSE 11.1, which has always had a hardlock problem with this video controller.  Also, the GMA 950, which seems to work perfectly fine after a fresh install, shows a similar 25% performance boost.  Kudos to the GEM developers and to openSUSE for getting it to work in 11.2!)

My hardware is an Acer Aspire 4330, using an Intel 4500M video controller.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Install openSUSE 11.2 Milestone 1
2.Allow installer to start detecting X configuration
3.Use power button to shut down the system after X has left you with a blank screen
Actual Results:  
Computer becomes unresponsive after each boot into X, and the X.org config seems to suggest that EXA acceleration architecture is used by default.

Expected Results:  
UXA works right with GEM, so it would be better to use the AccelMethod UXA at first boot if the 4500M is detected.

(Is this "Minor", because it's easy to fix?  Or is it "Critical", because it keeps the installer from finishing as normal?)

Upon starting installer for openSUSE Tumbleweed Snapshot 20211111, Xorg crashes and installation falls back to TUI mode.
After installation completes, system runs fine (hence why component set to YaST2).

Reproduction steps:
- sudo dd if=./openSUSE-Tumbleweed-DVD-x86_64-Snapshot20211111-Media.iso of=/dev/sdb bs=4M iflag=fullblock oflag=direct status=progress; sync
- boot from pendrive

Actual results:
When graphical interface is supposed to show up, I see a "Xorg core dumped" message (or something similar)

Expected results:
Graphical installer runs ok.

Extra info:

Hardware is Dell Precision 5530 laptop.

y2log attached, please let me know if anything else is required. I can easily boot to the installer to get whatever info is needed.

crash trace

Today kopete crashed again twice.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a new workflow definition

2) Add a state named "Start"

3) Add a state named "Next"

4) In state "Next", add a manual transition to "Start". (Note, at this point, there is no transition defined to get into state "Next". Leave it like that.)

5) Go to a folder and configure that folder to allow this workflow process to be used.

6) Create an entry in that folder

7) Go to the new entry and start the new workflow process on that entry

8) You will notice that there is no transition box

9) Go back to the Form/View Designer and add a manual transition from "Start" to "Next"

10) Go back to the entry that has the workflow process running. Now there will be a transition box to go to state "Next". Click OK to transition to "Next".

On Mon, 27 May 2013 09:29:27 +0200 Tomas Hoger wrote:


The issue was previously raised via this gnutls-devel mailing list post:



which does not mention all implications though.  Client crash is noted,
but affected code is used by the server code too, and allows easy remote
server crash, at least on some architectures.  You should only be
affected if you've upgraded to 2.12.23 or backported Lucky13 fix that
was applied to 2.x.  No 3.x version should be affected.

-- 
Tomas Hoger / Red Hat Security Response Team
===========================================================================

CVE-2017-2518

An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.2 is
affected. macOS before 10.12.5 is affected. tvOS before 10.2.1 is affected.
watchOS before 3.2.2 is affected. The issue involves the "SQLite" component. It
allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service
(buffer overflow and application crash) via a crafted SQL statement.

References:

PROBLEM STATEMENT

Selecting a menu child of a menu parent causes crash if the menu parent's menu bar parent (i.e., the menu child's grandparent) is not selected first.  To illustrate, consider the menustrip.py sample application:

The menustrip.py sample application has a menu bar (or MenuStrip) that has a 'File' menu.  The 'File' menu has several children, the first of which is another menu labeled 'New'.  The application will crash if the 'New' menu is selected by calling pyatspi's querySelection().selectChild(0) from the 'File' menu accessible, unless the querySelection().selectChild(0) was previous called from the menu bar accessible.

REPRO

1.  Run uia2atk/test/samples/menustrip.py
2.  Run the attached script, which does the following:
    a.  Finds the "File" menu accessible
    b.  Attempts to select it's 1st child, which is the "New" menu.

RESULTS

The application crashes, and prints the following trace:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File UIAutomationWinforms, line unknown, in PerformClick
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in ShowDropDown
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in get_DropDownLocation
  File menustrip, line unknown, in Initialize
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in Run
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in Run
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in RunLoop
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in GetMessage
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in GetMessage
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in ExecuteClientMessage
  File mscorlib, line unknown, in Run
  File mscorlib, line unknown, in Run
  File System.Windows.Forms, line unknown, in ExecutionCallback
  File mscorlib, line unknown, in DynamicInvoke
  File mscorlib, line unknown, in DynamicInvokeImpl
  File mscorlib, line unknown, in DynamicInvokeImpl
StandardError: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
Segmentation fault

EXPECTED RESULTS

Application should not crash.  It looks like Gtk doesn't display anything when something similar is attempted there.  But it doesn't seem like querySelection().selectChild(n) works that well for Gtk's MenuBar either.  So I am not entirely sure what we should do here... but we definitely shouldn't crash :)

COMMENTS

You can uncomment lines 18-20 in the attached script and then run it to see that the application doesn't crash if the 'File' menu is selected before trying to select the 'File' menu's child.

Another thing that may be worth mentioning:  Pressing 'Escape' immediately after opening the 'File' menu dismisses the 'File' menu, but selecting the 'File' menu's child afterwards doesn't not crash the application.  Lines 22-27 in the attached script can be uncommented to illustrate this behavior.  These lines must be uncommented in addition to lines 18-20.

The program 'fdesign' ( from the package xforms-tool-kit ) is quite old and bases directly on the xlib.
( This package has been widely known as 'xforms' before this name has been kidnapped by W3. )
 
After having installed 1.6.5-lp152.5.15.1, this application crashes directly after the start on one of the first button touches.

I returned to the former version 1.6.5-lp152.5.12.1 and it works again.

Because this program bases directly on the xlib, I assume that other x-based applications are also in danger.

(Also, here are still a lot of programs in science and industry, which base on the xforms-library, xforms-tool-kit )

Segmentation fault has been reported. In the next days I will try to find a more precise description.

PROBLEM STATEMENT

After inserting some text, a call to the EditableText interface's deleteText method can crash the application containing the MaskedTextBox whose text is being deleted.

REPRO

1.  Run uia2atk/test/samples/maskedtextbox.py.
2.  Open Accerciser and open the "IPython Console."
3.  In Accerciser, browse to and select the first MaskedTextBox accessible.  It
has a blank name and the "text" role.  This is the MaskedTextBox for date ("  /
 /    "), which has character count of 10.
4.  In the IPython console, run the following lines: 

    eti = acc.queryEditableText()
    # this next line is optional.  You can execute deleteText(...) as many
    # times as you want at this point and the application does not crash
    eti.deleteText(0, 20)
  
At this point there are at least two different ways to crash the
application.  You can perform step 5a or step 5b to crash the application.

5a.  In the IPython console, run the following lines: 

     eti.insertText(0, "11312009", 8)
     eti.deleteText(0, 20)
     eti.deleteText(0, 20)
 
5b.  In the IPython console, run the following lines: 

     eti.insertText(0, "1", 1)
     eti.deleteText(0, 20)

RESULTS

The sample application crashes and prints the following:

Exception in Gtk# callback delegate
  Note: Applications can use GLib.ExceptionManager.UnhandledException to handle the exception.
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: startIndex + count > this.length
Parameter name: count
  at System.String.Remove (Int32 startIndex, Int32 count) [0x00000] 
  at UiaAtkBridge.TextBoxEntryView.DeleteText (Int32 start_pos, Int32 end_pos) [0x00000] 
  at Atk.EditableTextAdapter.DeleteTextCallback (IntPtr text, Int32 start_pos, Int32 end_pos) [0x00000] 
   at GLib.ExceptionManager.RaiseUnhandledException(System.Exception e, Boolean is_terminal)
   at Atk.EditableTextAdapter.DeleteTextCallback(IntPtr text, Int32 start_pos, Int32 end_pos)
   at GLib.MainLoop.g_main_loop_run(IntPtr )
   at GLib.MainLoop.Run()
   at UiaAtkBridge.Monitor.GLibMainLoopThread()
Segmentation fault

EXPECTED RESULTS

deleteText() should return True and the application should not crash. 

COMMENTS

I have tried these steps with a Gtk TextView.

  <software>

I've setup accounts for MSN, Jabber and ICQ in Kopete and recently Kopete could not connect to ICQ anymore. It infinitely tries (the ICQ symbol is in "Connecting" state forever) and when I exit Kopete or click on the ICQ symbol and click on "offline", it crashes. In the case it does not crash when set to "offline" (this worked a few times), I can usually connect to ICQ by setting it manually to "online" again.

Xext/appgroup.c patch

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.1.0) Gecko/20090623 SUSE/3.5.0-96.2 Firefox/3.5

The Xorg server crashes when closing down an appgroup process.

The appgroup leader has closed down and one or more windows from the appgroup
session are left open.  When the remaining window(s) are closed, the Xorg server
crashes (sometimes).

Caused when windows in the appgroup are not correctly inserted into the appgroup
list at window create due to a coding error. 



Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. compile the xlaunch program to allow creation of appgroup sessions
2. run xltest script
3. close any leaked xterm's created by the script
Actual Results:  
up to 20 xterms are opened and one or more windows are left running 
when the appgroup leader exits.  Xorg server crashes when closing remaining
xterm windows.

Expected Results:  
up to 20 xterms are opened and then get closed each

On Tumbleweed Snapshot 20190108, when using yast in ncurses mode, opening many of its modules make Yast actually just return to the main view of all modules and an error is printed on the terminal:

Warning: unable to close filehandle __ANONIO__ properly: Bad file descriptor,
        <STDIN> line 2 during global destruction (#1)
    (S io) There were errors during the implicit close() done on a filehandle
    when its reference count reached zero while it was still open, e.g.:
    
        {
            open my $fh, '>', $file  or die "open: '$file': $!\n";
            print $fh $data or die "print: $!";
        } # implicit close here
    
    Because various errors may only be detected by close() (e.g. buffering could
    allow the print in this example to return true even when the disk is full),
    it is dangerous to ignore its result.  So when it happens implicitly, perl
    will signal errors by warning.
    
    Prior to version 5.22.0, perl ignored such errors, so the common idiom shown
    above was liable to cause silent data loss.

At least the following modules are opened fine: Software Management, Partitioner, System-Wide Fonts.

Also, note that this only happens in ncurses mode. When using the qt interface, all modules work fine.

2.connect to this computer using vnc
3.hold the title bar of a window and try to move it -> connection broken :(

So i have a filetree (VfsNodeView). Drives which do not have a mounted 
volume yet (an empty CD/DVD-rom drive) show up, but aren't mounted (if at 
all possible) until the user tries to access that node. This is the same 
behavior as GtkFileChooser.

The operation in question is gnome_vfs_drive_mount, or Drive.Mount in 
Gtk#. The C code waits until it knows if the mount succeeded or not using 
a new mainloop:

loop = g_main_loop_new (...)
gnome_vfs_drive_mount (volume_mount_cb);
g_main_loop_run (); // this blocks until g_main_loop_quit in the handler

if (mount_succeeded)
  ...


static void
volume_mount_cb (bool succeeded, string error, string details)
{
  mount_succeeded = succeeded;
  g_main_loop_quit (loop);
}

Now, when i attempt to use the same mechanism in Gtk#, i get a double free 
crash at the end of the VolumeOpCallback (the OnMount handler). This is 
related to the error and details strings. This behavior isn't always 
consistent, but most of the times it crashes. Sometimes the first attempt 
goes ok, but it crashes on the second attempt. It's a "hard" crash. See 
the attached backtrace for more info.

I've also attached VfsNodeView.cs and TestVfsNodeView.cs so you should be 
able to reproduce the problem. Just click on the expand arrow next to the 
CD/DVD drive when there's no CD/DVD in it. You should see the same output 
in the terminal as in the backtrace.

The editor "nano" crashes with message:

Search: Las*** glibc detected *** nano: malloc(): memory corruption (fast): 0x0000000000632ff0 ***

when searches for some string ('Last' in the example above) in some text file. 

The crash happens if nano is launched from a regular user profile.

If one swithes to root with 

su

then searches for some string in a text file with nano. It finds the searched for string if available and gives Segmentation fault and returns to the command prompt when another button is pressed. The "Segmentation fault text" is enteren on the position of the cursor replacing whatever is next.

If one swithes to root with 

su -l  (or su -)

nano works fine. No noticeable problems or crashes.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open some text file with nano from a regular user profile
2. press ctrl+w and enter some string to search for
3. press enter to execute the search
Actual Results:  
Different dopending on the profile/environment. Described in the "Details" section.

no crashes or segmentation faults are expected.

From this message it seems that somehow, the Desktop directory has 
made the application to crash, so I temporarily removed the "Desktop" 
directory. But it didn't worked, the application has failed again, 
this time complaining about the "Documents" folder. I moved the 
"Documents" folder away and I tried to run the application but I had 
no luck, this time the next folder in the list has represented a 
problem for gnome_icon_lookup_sync method. I modified the 
FileIconLoader.cs code to  figure out what is happening.. It seems to 
me that the Gnome.Icon.LookupSync method called at line 43 of the 
FileIconLoader.cs file fails to execute for ANY valid file or 
directory name of my home directory. I commented out this function and 
set the icon variable to "gnome-fs-regular" and everything was OK, the 
application finally ran. I know this is not a solution and does not 
solve the problem.

* I don't know if this is a regression of  or related to it, so I opened a new one. *

I was wondering why I permanently get those 'java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space' errors resulting in eclipse crashing when running eclipse on openSUSE 11.1. Allthough I modified '/etc/eclipse.conf' and added '-XX:MaxPermSize=256M' to the VM_ARGS this doesn't seem to have any effect.

Investigating in a running eclipse 'Help > About Eclipse SDK > Configuration Details' shows the problem:

*** System properties:
...
-vm /usr/lib64/jvm/java/bin/java
-vmargs -Xms256m -Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=256M
-vm
/usr/bin/java
eclipse.ee.install.verify=false
eclipse.home.location=file:/usr/lib64/eclipse/
eclipse.launcher=/usr/lib64/eclipse/eclipse
eclipse.product=org.eclipse.sdk.ide
eclipse.startTime=1231249746644
eclipse.vm=/usr/bin/java
eclipse.vmargs=-jar
/usr/share/eclipse/./plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.100.v20080509-1800.jar
...

As you can see 'eclipse.vmargs' is empty, although the '-vmargs -Xms256m -Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=256M' was passed.

Looking at the running processes reveals:
# less /etc/eclipse.conf
linux:/home/user1 # ps aux | grep java

---- Additional Comments From  2005-01-28 09:03:11 MST ----

After adding some debug output, i noticed the following:

In Signal.ReturnGType, the switch (retval.CSType) falls through to the
default handler, which is responsible for the exception. The reason
for this is that retval.CSType == "Gst.Caps". igen is of type BoxedGen.

This is how the signal is created:

  gst_real_pad_signals[REAL_FIXATE] =
      g_signal_new ("fixate", G_TYPE_FROM_CLASS (klass),
G_SIGNAL_RUN_LAST,
      G_STRUCT_OFFSET (GstRealPadClass, fixate),
      _gst_real_pad_fixate_accumulator, NULL,
      gst_marshal_BOXED__BOXED, GST_TYPE_CAPS, 1,
      GST_TYPE_CAPS | G_SIGNAL_TYPE_STATIC_SCOPE);

What's the proper solution here?



---- Additional Comments From  2005-01-28 12:42:29 MST ----

something like:

if (igen is BoxedGen)
   return retval.CSType + ".GType";

---- Additional Comments From  2006-08-24 19:42:07 MST ----

A Bitmap instance is being created with a Height = 0, which generates
the exception. I'm taking a deep look into the ReportBuilderCode, to
catch the error.



---- Additional Comments From  2006-08-25 17:02:58 MST ----

Ok, the problem appears to be directly related to DataGrid.DataSource.
When DataGRid.BeginInit () is invoked and then DataGrid.DataSource is
assigned, it will remain with the previous value until
DataGrid.EndInit () is called, and DataSource gets a refresh. In .Net,
even when EndInit hasn't been called, DataSource acquires the new value.

Now, I don't know enough about DataGrid, and probably this is a bad
practice (to call EndInit without calling EndInit), but I think we
have to solve this issue anyway.

(The attached sample should print a value different than "null").



---- Additional Comments From  2006-08-25 17:10:39 MST ----

using System;
using System.Windows.Forms;

public class Test
{
        static void Main ()
        {
                DataGrid dg = new DataGrid ();
                dg.BeginInit ();
                dg.DataSource = new string [] {"Carlos", "Alberto"};
                MessageBox.Show ("DataSource = " + (dg.DataSource ==
null ? "null" : dg.DataSource)); // Shouldn't be null
        }
}

'Meeting Bug report' attached.

Nautilus does not show the media action dialog when I insert hardware (specifically testing with an audio CD, but likely this is common to any kind of DeviceAdded message from HAL). 

Because there also appears to be a crash in libgnomebreakpad, no indication of a crash is presented to the user, Nautilus just restarts and the cursor is "busy" for a few seconds.

This is likely a problem inside libhal. I traced it down to filter_func inside of libhal.c inside the handler for the DeviceAdded message:

    if (ctx->device_removed != NULL) {
        ctx->device_removed (ctx, udi);
    }

ctx->device_removed is 0x88 for me, which seems like a pretty odd address. In any case, the NULL check fails, it's called, and we crash. Additionally, there appears to be a further crash inside of libgnomebreakpad.

 "If you aren't using the Record extension (and you aren't), you can work
  around the bug by moving the code which accesses the (non-existant)
  request buffer inside the loop looking at the recording contexts (of
  which there should be none):"

diff --git a/record/record.c b/record/record.c
index 68311ac..9e36103 100644
--- a/record/record.c
+++ b/record/record.c
@@ -603,12 +603,10 @@ RecordAReply(CallbackListPtr *pcbl, pointer nulldata, pointer calldata)
    RecordContextPtr pContext;
    RecordClientsAndProtocolPtr pRCAP;
    int eci;
-    int majorop;
    ReplyInfoRec *pri = (ReplyInfoRec *)calldata;
    ClientPtr client = pri->client;
    REQUEST(xReq);

-    majorop = stuff->reqType;
    for (eci = 0; eci < numEnabledContexts; eci++)
    {
       pContext = ppAllContexts[eci];
@@ -616,6 +614,7 @@ RecordAReply(CallbackListPtr *pcbl, pointer nulldata, pointer calldata)

       if (pRCAP)
       {

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use X
2. Do something random (google-chrome seems to trigger it on some sites more easily)
3. Crash
Actual Results:  
X crash: screen goes black, two seconds afterwards you get the Login screen. All unsaved work lost.

Expected Results:  
Working desktop

Please do try to merge this, it makes the current OpenSUSE setup very fragile.

PROBLEM STATEMENT:

select item with scrollbar role below ipy in accerciser tree view would cause lsitbox.py, checkedlistbox.py app crash.


REPRO:

1. run accerciser
2. run uia2atk/test/samples/listbox.py (checkedlistbox.py)
3. in accerciser, expand 'ipy' on the left tree, select scrollbar item


RESULTS:

application crash and app window disappear

EXPECTED RESULTS:

scrollbar item can be selected and also can up and down value


COMMENTS:
terminal return some info:

The latest "update" xorg-x11-driver-video-7.3-138.3.i586 blindly enabled EXA acceleration mode on intel video cards.  This causes application crashes in Firefox and Moonlight (at the very least) as we try to create pixmaps > 8188 bytes wide.

I've attached a patch which fixes the issue of the application crashes, however the greater issue is how such a major change could even be contemplated for an update release and wasn't pushed to 11.1.

Changing the AccelMode of a driver is not a trivial change as it forces applications to go thru new, untested codepaths (as seen), and will have possibly dramatic performance impacts or application crash

 is the relevent reference bug for the decision process to enable EXA mid-release.

I just ran an update on one of my 15.1 systems running 389-ds.
So I got 1.4.2.6 compared to 1.4.0.3 I had before.

After the upgrade two things happened:

1. my users could not authenticate anymore (for example in Dovecot)
2. 389-ds crashed several times

---- Additional Comments From  2005-12-03 16:21:11 MST ----

You need to install either mozilla or firefox in a place where
monodevelop can find it.  If you have it in a weird location you can
set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME or LD_LIBRARY_PATH to the directory with
libgtkembedmoz.so

(ex. /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/libgtkembedmoz.so)

Apparantly this installer does not do dependency checking?

Created 
The Digikam / Bugreporter crash report.

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; de; rv:1.9.2.0) Gecko/20100115 SUSE/3.6.0-1.2 Firefox/3.6

Lately Digikam is basically unusable: it constantly crashes, preferred when I try to save a photo.

Digikam is version 0.10.0
KDE is version 4.3.5
Kernel is version 2.6.31.8-0.1-desktop (Version 2.6.31.12-0.1-desktop gets stuck when doing a shutdown)

OS is OpenSUSE 11.2 for 64 bit Intel

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Digikam
2. Edit a few photos & seve the changes
3. It will crash within three photos.
Actual Results:  
Segmentation Fault. Crash report

Expected Results:  
Saved the photo and allowed me to edit the next one.

The crash is so frequent that Digikam is unusable until it is fixed.

As I suspect the 4.3.5 packages I have tried to revert Kwin,KDEPIM and KDEBASE to the 4.3.1 versions, but this did not help.

I have not yet tried to update KDE to the 4.4 factory version yet.

/* querying capabilities */
  GstURIType		(* get_type)				(void);
  gchar **		(* get_protocols)			(void);

These virtual methods (part of the GstURIHandler interface in gstreamer)
are parsed as follows:

    <interface name="URIHandler" cname="GstURIHandler">
      <signal name="NewUri" cname="new-uri" when="LAST">
        <return-type type="void" />
        <parameters>
          <parameter type="GstURIHandler*" name="handler" />
          <parameter type="const-gchar*" name="uri" />
        </parameters>
      </signal>
      <virtual_method name="GetType" cname="get_type" hidden="1">
        <return-type type="GstURIType" />
      </virtual_method>
      <virtual_method name="GetProtocols" cname="get_protocols">
        <return-type type="gchar**" />
      </virtual_method>
      <virtual_method name="GetUri" cname="get_uri">
        <return-type type="const-gchar*" />
        <parameters>
          <parameter type="GstURIHandler*" name="handler" />
        </parameters>
      </virtual_method>

If you need additional info let me know.

Steps to reproduce:

1. make sure akregator is running and that openSUSE news is _not_ in the list of feeds
2. open www.opensuse.org/en/ in konqueror
3. click on the orange button in the lower-right corner to subscribe to rss feed

if akregtor did not fail, delete newly added feed from akregator and repeat step 3.

reproducible: almost always

puzel@foxbat:~> rpm -q kde4-akregator
kde4-akregator-4.1.2-1.2

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; de; rv:1.9.1.6) Gecko/20091201 Firefox/3.5.6 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)

yast -i crashes after an update of yast2-ncurses-2.18.11-0.1.1 with a segmentation fault

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install yast2-ncurses-2.18.11-0.1.1
2. run yast -i
Actual Results:  
/sbin/yast: line 454: 29832 Segmentation fault      $ybindir/y2base $module "$@" "$SELECTED_GUI" $Y2_GEOMETRY $Y2UI_ARGS

Expected Results:  
The Yast Software Manager should start

User-Agent:       Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 6.1; U; en) Presto/2.6.30 Version/10.60

The source code of the self compiled version is from the schily's site at: 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. /usr/bin/star -c f=/dev/null /usr/src/linux-2.6.34-12

---- Additional Comments From  2005-11-04 16:00:15 MST ----

This is a known issue in MD 0.7 that was fixed in 0.8. The problem was
a conflict between the gtk# assemblies referenced in the project and
the assemblies loaded to run MD. As a workaround you can manually
change in the mdp file all references to 1.0.0.0 assemblies to 2.0.0.0
(or whatever 2.x version you have). In any case, I highly recomend
upgrading to 0.8.


Unknown bug field "cf_version_details" encountered while moving bug
   <cf_version_details>GNOME2.10.2 unspecified</cf_version_details>

PROBLEM STATEMENT

The sample applications are crashing when being opened from the Orca test harness'.

REPRO

1.  Set up an Orca testing environment.  See the requirements .
2.  Run '~/code/orca/test/harness/runone.sh ~/code/uia2atk/test/keystrokes/winforms/winbutton.py/winbutton.py ~/code/uia2atk/test/samples/winbutton.py 0'.  Of course the directory names will change depending on your setup.

RESULTS

The test attempts to open the winbutton.py sample, but the sample crashes before starting:

a11y@suse32v0:~> ~/code/orca/test/harness/runone.sh ~/code/uia2atk/test/keystrokes/winforms/winbutton.py/winbutton.py ~/code/uia2atk/test/samples/winbutton.py 0
debugFile: winbutton
Using settings file: /home/a11y/code/uia2atk/test/keystrokes/winforms/winbutton.py/winbutton.settings
starting test application /home/a11y/code/uia2atk/test/samples/winbutton.py ...
Exception in Gtk# callback delegate
  Note: Applications can use GLib.ExceptionManager.UnhandledException to handle the exception.
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at UiaAtkBridge.ComponentParentAdapter.OnRefStateSet () [0x00000] 
  at UiaAtkBridge.Window.OnRefStateSet () [0x00000] 
  at Atk.Object.RefStateSet_cb (IntPtr raw) [0x00000] 
   at GLib.ExceptionManager.RaiseUnhandledException(System.Exception e, Boolean is_terminal)
   at Atk.Object.RefStateSet_cb(IntPtr raw)
   at GLib.MainLoop.g_main_loop_run(IntPtr )
   at GLib.MainLoop.Run()
   at UiaAtkBridge.Monitor.GLibMainLoopThread()
Macaroon timeout: Wait for window Buttons to get activated

EXPECTED RESULTS

The sample application should open and the test should proceed.

COMMENTS

This does not happen with older RPMs (for example, the RPMs from 011409-12).  Additionally, all of the samples can be opened just fine when they are opened directly from the command line, that is '~/code/uia2atk/test/samples/winbutton.py' will open the winbutton sample just fine.  

Marking this as a Blocker as it blocks any Orca testing.  Ray is able to get the application not to crash by opening Orca before running the runone.sh script and then using the '1' option instead of '0' (which simply tells runone.sh that Orca is already open).

Created 
Patch that makes plasma not crash when the twitter plasmoid is configured

There is a bug in KDE 4.1 which lets plasma crash on plasmoids showing the "This applet needs to be configured" overlay. The crash happens when the applet is hovered after the plasmoid was configured.

See  for the upstream bug.

The attached patch does not fix the issue but works around the crash by disabling that overlay. Maybe we should include it until the base problem is fixed in plasma.

After the online update () e.g. trying to launch KWrite results in KWrite reporting that it can't find the editing component and crashing. Running 'kbuildsycoca4 --noincremental' manually fixed the problem.

There's a long-standing issue on the KDE bugtracker with Klipper crashes, if an action is offered and clicked twice (the action menu even doesn't close after the first click):


This problem ist still present with the current KDE 4.2 Factory packages for OpenSUSE 11.1.

They refer this as fixed by this patch:

but I'm not sure whether their trunk already concerned KDE 4.3. DO you know whether this has been backported to KDE 4.2 and does really fix the problem described there. This is 100% reproducable, see below.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Klipper in KDE 4.2
2. Enable Actions on Klipper
2. Copy an HTTP URL of your choice for which the Klipper action menu is opened
3. Click on "Open with Firefox" (regardles whether Firefox is already running)
   The Klipper action menu is still open after this click.
4. Click on "Open with Firefox" a second time.
Actual Results:  
Klipper crashes

Expected Results:  
Klipper should close the action menu after an action was chosen.

User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; it; rv:1.9.1.3) Gecko/20090909 SUSE/3.5.3-3.2 Firefox/3.5.3

message:
** ERROR **: file exceptions-ppc.c: line 930 (ves_icall_get_trace): assertion failed: (ji != NULL)
aborting...

It works fine in the beta 1 release of mono, and it works if I use mint.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Download 
2. unpack it (I had to use the unzip command manually as stuffit messed up the paths)
3. in a shell, cd into the NUnit distributions bin directory
4. edit nunit-console.exe.config and remove the part in the first line about the windows file 
encoding
5. run NUnit's own tests:
    mono nunit-console.exe nunit.tests.dll

Actual Results:

** ERROR **: file exceptions-ppc.c: line 930 (ves_icall_get_trace): assertion failed: (ji != NULL)
aborting...

Expected Results:

Output about which tests pass/fail.  You can run this command to see what it should look like:

mint nunit-console.exe nunit.tests.dll

How often does this happen? 

Happens 100% of the time.

Additional Information:

Created an attachment (id=170450)
A slightly simpler test case. (I hit this same error today.)




---- Additional Comments From  2006-09-12 21:40:11 MST ----

RichTextBox also has this problem, so this is mostly a TextBoxBase issue.

The problem appears when calculating the ClientSize in Hwnd.
GetWindowRectangle (when trying to Set Bounds), specifically in the lines:

if (border_style == FormBorderStyle.Fixed3D) {
...
   rect.Width += border_3D_size.Width * 2;

The ThemeEngine.Border3DSize is always of Width = 2, so this could
explain why the minimum size for avoiding the exception is Width>= 4

I also noted that the CreateParams property appears to be different
than that one in .Net. I don't know if this is the source of the
problem, though.




---- Additional Comments From  2006-09-13 10:06:37 MST ----

I observed that .Net doesn't draw the borders when the Width is 
minor than 4 (which appears to be the border size). 

So I made a little change in TextBoxBase.CreateParams, to avoid 
taking into account the borders if the Width is minor than the 
current's theme border  size.

This fixed the problem for both RichTextBox and TextBox.



---- Additional Comments From  2006-09-13 10:07:13 MST ----

Created an attachment (id=170451)
Proposed patch

Created 
fixed /etc/init.d/dbus

During debuging a problem at shutdown (see ) the
systems hangs at calling

   /etc/init.d/dbus stop

sometimes the message that /usr/sbin/console-kit-daemon had
crashed within /usr/lib/libglib-2.0.so.0 ...

I can avoid the problem by adding

        killproc -TERM /usr/sbin/console-kit-daemon

before

        killproc -p $DBUS_DAEMON_PID -TERM $DBUS_DAEMON_BIN

... beside this the script is broken ... a) the killproc binary
its self remove the pid file on success and b) at the end of
line of a shell script no semi colon is required (this is not
perl nor C/C++).

The installer crash with an internal error when trying to upgrade a Leap 15.1 having some repo using the ${releasever} libzypp variable.

Steps to reproduce

- Install a Leap 15.1
- Add a repo using the ${releasever} variable

  For example, 
  
  zypper ar -f } LibreOffice

- Try to perform an upgrade to Leap 15.2

Note that the problem is only present when using the libzypp variables enclosed in curly braces. In this case, when using ${releasever}, but not when using $releasever.

The fix in XLib.pm (in yast2-x11) is a call to setPrimaryChip(); for details see ().
If this "fix" is activated sax will create a broken xorg.conf and return empty data to yast2-x11. Disabling this single call solves this issue. The fix for multicard setups is gone with this too.

I will submit a fixed yast2-x11 just right now to get a usable beta1.
This bug is meant to track the issue in the sax-library that caused the problem.

---- Additional Comments From  2006-10-05 23:25:47 MST ----

this wasn't actually a datagrid bug.  It turns out the combobox was
always one step behind - you needed to select 2 things, then click
update and it would make use of the first thing you selected..

confusing, yes.  anyway, it works now.  If you click "Update" twice on
a given selection, we still throw an exception.  But since windows
throws the same one, I don't think it's a bug.

This should be fixed in cvs.

This problem occurs with the current 4.0.85 packages, however, all previous versions of KDE4.1 I installed from the openSUSE repos had this problem, too, for months:

Using the KDE slideshow screensaver, only a few pictures are displayed. Sooner or later the screensaver freezes and cannot any more be disabled (mousepointer is visible and movable, but the normal desktop does not return any more). "top" shows kwin eating up all the CPU time, it has to be "kill"ed in order to be able to return to the KDE session.

Created 
Screenshot of Bug

NOTE: This is a generic X bug. It affects all desktops. X loads fine, but when the first dialog is closed, the display pixelates (checkerboards) and distorts like the checkerboard is wrapping from top-right to bottom-left around-and-around the screen. (at least 4 wraps around a 1440x900 display)

(screenshot grabbed in the blind w/ksnapshot)


    This is bizarre. If you don't touch the display after X starts, everything looks fine. If you do nothing, the screensaver starts and looks fine. If you cancel the screensaver (enter password), you get back to the original desktop just fine. BUT if you close any dialog or open any window on the original display - Wham you get this pixelation.

    The same thing occurs with TWM, flux, etc.. You can look at the display, but once you open or close the first window - boom! The display scrambles.

dmesg and Xorg files:





    This may NOT just be a SuSE issue! I have seen this on Arch with the newer Xorg as well. (I never followed it up there, I just put my suse 11.0 drive back in the laptop). Also, this does NOT effect nvidia boxes. I have the current Xorg running on nvidia boxes with no problem. (although I have notices an intermittent hiccup in the displays) This may not effect all radeon boxes either, but it does affect the X12xx X13xx series cards (lots of laptops).

    This install replaced my 11.0 install that has been on this box since it was released. This is my production box and I have to get this solved. For 11.4, it needs to be solved FAST, as I suspect all radeon X12xx and X13xx cards are effected.

    What to try? I have got to get this fixed ASAP. Thanks.

(files reference above included as attachments)

Description of Problem:
Any program crashes (Segmentation Fault) if the <sharedListeners> section is presented in the App.config (even if when no one listener is in the section) and the program try to create any TraceSource instance.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create any program which creates TraceSource instance (for example just simple console application containing just the 'Main(...)' method containing one line: TraceSource ts = new TraceSource ("any name");
2. Create App.Config for this program containing <sharedListeners> section (does not matter whether this section is empty <sharedListeners/> or it contains any listeners inside.
3. Execute the program.

or

1. Unpack & Open AppConfigTest solution
2. Look at really simple Main.cs and App.config files
3. Build and execute

Actual Results:
A program crashes (Segmentation Fault)

Expected Results:
Program shall not crash.

How often does this happen? 
Everytime

Additional Information:
A program will NOT crash if there is NOT created any instance of the TraceSource in somewhere in the program code, OR if the <sharedListeners> section is not presented in the App.config file.

I am usinng the update-test repository and got an update for java 1.6 u12 today.

Sadly this makes my firefox hang completely going on any java enabled site.

/etc/alternatives/javaplugin was set to /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.6.0-sun-1.6.0/jre/lib/i386/libnpjp2.so after the update.

Setting it to /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.6.0-sun-1.6.0/jre/plugin/i386/ns7/libjavaplugin_oji.so solves the problem for me.

A local user can trigger a flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of key lookups in the keychain subsystem.

The key_reject_and_link() function contains an error in which a key-lookup can fail and in an attempt to cache the failed lookup may attempt to free memory which can still be in use.

This could crash the system or at worse free a memory block which would then be re-used by another kernel mechanism causing a user after free.

Product bug:



Upstream patch:

I tried to to install MonoDevelop on my new SUSE 10 RC1 installation, but it
crashed right on startup. After analyzing the exception I found that it's
dependent on the (not installed by YaST!) Mono-Web package. Mono and GTK# seems
to work fine as MonoDoc runs fine. However MonoDevelop still won't start, tried
reinstalling Mono and MonoDevelop without success.
